basic.floral_language:
Cistus monspeliensis
Floriography optimistic, young and strong 
Cistus monspeliensis generally refers to wild rose. Five to nine lobules with oval shape. Leaves are stretched and pilose. Flowers are 5-7 clustered on the top branches. The color of rose is rich and gorgeous, and the aroma is attractive. Generally, rose grows in the roadsides, or along with the field, it is also used in decoration of flower beds, flower shelf and tracery wall, etc. 
Cistus monspeliensis maintenance is simple, and it like the sunshine. Flowering from May to September, is available for viewing for 2-3 weeks each period.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-September, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, put in sunny places, avoid strong sunlight in summer at noon
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce watering in winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply 2-3 times monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased, dead leaves and withered flowers timely
